body: Is there a suggested work around or way to fix this?

To be honest, I haven't dug to deep for an actual fix in rollup.

As far as work arounds, I think if you name the default variable the same as the file name imported, you shouldn't run into the problem.

issue.title: Rollup doesn't correctly mangle names
issue.body:
Example: https://rollupjs.org/repl?version=0.41.6&

bounds-the-function and bounds-the-argument are two things. It works correctly when I change the import line to `import mkBounds from './bounds.js';` and then use `(bounds = mkBounds())`.

issue.title: Upgrade to rollup v0.50 [DO NOT MERGE]

repository.name: iD
repository.description: üÜî The easy-to-use OpenStreetMap editor in JavaScript.

issue.body:
This is just to upgrade to rollup v0.50

There is a rollup bug that seems to be affecting our d3 import.:  https://github.com/rollup/rollup/issues/1338 , https://github.com/rollup/rollup/issues/1411

So we can't actually take this upgrade until either the bug is fixed, or we stop using a `*` star import of d3 (this is #3948)

issue.title: export * cause variable collision
Reexport namespace deshadow
issue.body: This fixes #1338 ensuring namespace exports which are in turn reexported are properly traced during deshadowing.

issue.title: namespaced imports with same name as local identifier causes runtime error when namespace is removed by rollup
